channel.title: Interleaved RSS Feed
channel.description: This is an interleaved feed of the most recent entries from each RSS source, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: Biden Condemns Protest Outside Los Angeles Synagogue as Antisemitic
item.description: After a clash between pro-Palestinian and pro-Israel demonstrators turned violent over the weekend, leaders said such protests outside houses of worship were unacceptable.

item.title: Middle East Crisis: Israel’s Defense Minister Holds Talks in Washington on War’s Next Phase
item.description: Yoav Gallant said his meetings with top U.S. officials this week would involve the Gaza war’s “transition” to a new stage.

item.title: Nvidia stock is now in a correction as deepening selloff puts the AI chip giant’s market cap below $3 trillion
item.description: The three-day drop erased more than $400 billion from Nvidia’s market capitalization.

item.title: Gay Marriage Was a Big Missed Opportunity
item.description: The modest campaign created an opening for today’s anti-L.G.B.T.Q. backlash.

item.title: Israeli Strike Kills Director of Ambulance Services, Gaza Officials Say
item.description: Health officials in the enclave said Hani al-Jafarawi, who directed movements of emergency medical personnel, was killed when a clinic in Gaza City was struck.

item.title: Armed with $100,000 from the Heritage Foundation, conservative group plans to out government ‘anti-American bad actors’ it believes will resist Trump
item.description: The goal of the American Accountability Foundation is to publish a list of 100 high-ranking government employees hostile to the former president, starting with the Department of Homeland Security.

item.title: Extreme Wildfires Have Doubled in 2 Decades, Study Finds
item.description: In a changing climate, extreme wildfire events are becoming far more common and more intense, according to a new analysis.

item.title: Hajj Deaths in Saudi Arabia: What to Know
item.description: The number of deaths during the annual Islamic pilgrimage raised questions about Saudi Arabia’s preparations for intense heat and unregistered participants.

item.title: Greece is moving some workers toward a 6-day workweek
item.description: 48-hour work week kicks off on July 1.

item.title: How Much Is the Health of Biden and Trump Our Business?
item.description: We live in an age when people can live longer and healthier even with significant health conditions. What does this mean for future presidents?

item.title: Fire at Lithium Battery Plant in South Korea Kills at Least 22
item.description: The blaze was one of the country’s deadliest in recent years. Most of the victims were migrant workers from China.

item.title: Target’s online marketplace pales in comparison to Walmart and Amazon, and now it’s betting on a shiny new deal with Shopify to woo customers
item.description: The partnership will be a first for Target Plus, which has historically been a more selective platform for third-party vendors.

item.title: It’s the Golden Age of Weird Vehicles
item.description: Standup scooters, electric unicycles, homemade contraptions of all sorts. New Yorkers have plenty of ways to get around.

item.title: Iran’s Onerous Hijab Law for Women Is Now a Campaign Issue
item.description: In a sign that a women-led movement has gained ground, all of the men running for president have distanced themselves from the harsh tactics used to enforce mandatory hijab.

item.title: The national debt is over $34 trillion. It’s time to tell the truth about the U.S. government’s finances
item.description: The U.S. government will pay close to $900 billion this year just in interest payments on the national debt.
